result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Chester Francis Neumann Jr. was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit DNA sample if not already completed and pay $250 surcharge.
Attorney fees to be determined.

No operating a vehicle without a valid license.  Not allowed to possess firearms.    May not vote or sit on a jury until civil rights are restored.  May not be in taverns or bars or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants and grocery stores.  Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.    No possession or consumption of prescription medications without a valid prescription and then only according to Dr.'s orders.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare as recommended by agent.

timeConds.notes: No good time unless required by statute, credit for 69 days and huber release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.
